['Here are some examples:', '"An apple a day keeps the doctor away." - This maxim suggests that doing something good for yourself every day (in this case, eating an apple) can have long-term benefits for your health.', '"A stitch in time saves nine." - This adage means that taking care of small problems as they arise can prevent bigger problems from developing later on.', '"Absence makes the heart grow fonder." - This maxim suggests that being away from someone can strengthen one\'s feelings for them.', '"Actions speak louder than words." - This adage means that it\'s not enough to say something, you have to back it up with action.', '"All\'s fair in love and war." - This maxim suggests that in situations where emotions are high (love or war), anything goes and there are no rules.', '"Bite off more than you can chew." - This adage means to take on more responsibility or tasks than you are capable of handling.', '"Blood is thicker than water." - This maxim suggests that family ties are stronger than any other relationship.', '"A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush." - This adage means that it\'s better to have a small, certain advantage than to take a risk and possibly lose everything.', '"Burning the midnight oil." - This maxim refers to working late into the night, often to meet a deadline or complete a task.', '"Cut your coat according to your cloth." - This adage means to be practical and adapt to your circumstances, rather than trying to maintain a certain standard or lifestyle that is unrealistic for you.', '"Don\'t count your chickens before they hatch." - This maxim means don\'t assume something will happen or someone will do something until it has actually happened.', '"An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure." - This adage suggests that taking steps to prevent problems before they occur is better than trying to fix them after the fact.', '"Don\'t cry over spilled milk." - This maxim means don\'t waste time feeling sorry for something that has already happened and can\'t be changed.', '"Don\'t put all your eggs in one basket." - This adage means to diversify and spread your resources or investments across multiple areas, rather than putting everything into one thing.', '"Don\'t let the grass grow under your feet." - This maxim means to take action quickly and don\'t delay, especially when it comes to opportunities or tasks that need to be completed.', '"A rolling stone gathers no moss." - This adage suggests that someone who is constantly moving around and not settling in one place will not accumulate wealth or possessions.', '"A hard head makes a soft neck." - This maxim means that someone who is stubborn and refuses to listen to reason will eventually suffer the consequences of their actions.', '"Happy wife, happy life." - This adage suggests that if you want to have a happy marriage, you should make sure your partner is happy and fulfilled.', '"A penny saved is a penny earned." - This adage means that saving money is just as important as earning it.', '"Red sky at night, sailor\'s delight; red sky in the morning, sailor\'s warning." - This maxim refers to the fact that a red sky at night indicates fair weather for sailors, while a red sky in the morning warns them of impending bad weather.']
